results.title: Change in the Maritimes
results.creator_credit: Robin Spry, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film examines the changing economy of Canada’s Atlantic provinces and the factors that contributed to the expansion of industry in the early to mid-1960s. The film focuses primarily on the choice confronting many inshore fishermen - whether to stay with the free but frugal life that their nets provide, or to move to the city. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Chance History Art
results.brief_description: Shows six artists at work, one of them being Jimmy Boyle, the prisoner who spends his time in prison sculpting. Three themes interweave through the film - Chance; the role of accident in painting and change in performance - History; connections with surrealism and politics - Art; the present day, the way art merges with everyday life and is mediated by institutions

results.title: Champions of the Australian Turf
results.brief_description: Captures the real stories behind Australian racing’s undisputed idols through the performances and personalities that make them great. Presented as a History of Racing, you’ll see Australia’s first race meeting in 1810, the 1866 Melbourne Cup, the Carbine story, Phar Lap’s greatest victories, Peter Pan and Chatham in the Craven Plate, Ajax winning his third Memsie Stakes, Bernborough’s amazing races, Tulloch winning the AJC Derby and Caulfield Cup, Todman - the fastest two year old, contemporary champion, Kingston Town and Beau Zam, Australia’s first $2 million earner.

results.title: Challenges and rebirth
results.creator_credit: Lin Yung, Jao Ming, Weng Jeng-Yih and Kwang Hwa Mass Communications
results.brief_description: Documents the achievements of the Taiwanese people since the establishment of the Republic of China in 1949. The transition was difficult, but through hard work and dedication, Taiwan made its mark on the world marketplace. In the 21st Century, the Taiwanese are dedicated to further developing their “laissez-faire’ economy and democratic reforms.

results.title: Challenge of the oceans
results.creator_credit: Arnold Frutkin, Hugh Odishaw, Stanley Ruttenberg, Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: A study of the physical, chemical and biological aspects of the oceans, showing the scope and objectives of oceanographic exploration. Explores the causes and reasons for the ocean currents and methods of measuring ocean depth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arnold Frutkin, Hugh Odishaw, Stanley Ruttenberg, Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)

results.title: Developmental biology
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Examines the orderly and inevitable life cycle of an organism from the moment of fertilization through embryology to maturation. This film also probes the role of genetic programming in this biological mystery. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Cell biology
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Commencing with 3.5 billion year old fossil evidence, this program traces cellular development from prokaryotes, the cellular pioneers of our oxygen based ecology system, through to the eukaryotic cells, which compose all advanced forms of life. Introduces recent theory to explain the quantam leap forward in complexity from prokaryotes to eukaryotic cells. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Genetic biology
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Bruce J. Russell, Biomedia Associates and Coronet
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Examines two qualities that are essential to the existence of species: the genetic mechanisms that preserve continuity from one generation to the next and the mechanisms that ensure variation. Also explores the recent breakthroughs of molecular genetics in the area of recombinant DNA which have led to biological applications with strong social implications.

results.title: Ecological biology
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
Shows that an ecosystem is a system of interactions between the physical environment and the varied species populations which inhabit it. Describes how the ecological relationships in any given environment follow basic principles. Indicates that our own human species must make informed decisions based on an awareness of these principles and highlights the consequences of ignoring them. Stresses that human activities must be adapted to maintain the delicate balance of a complex worldwide ecosystem.
